body.p: We the the true Union men of Harrison county would respectfully request that Capt James H. Coffman of Col Mundy's battalion of infantry Cavalry be promoted to Colonel of a Ky Cavalry regiment.
His good conduct, his bravery and efficincy as an officer while at Cumberland cap entitle him to promotion.
Capt. Coffman was raised in this county, we know him well, and would be gratified to hear of his promotion, knowing him to be worthy.

Isaac Taylor 1st Lt Co. D 1st Batt Ky Cav.
Walter F Stafford Capt. Co. A. 1st Batt 1 Ky, Cav,
David, L, Cook 1st Lt Co A 1st Batt Ky cav
H. Brent Kelly Adjutant 1st Battalion Ky. Cavalry,
Lieut O. W. Ballew 1st Battalion, Ky, cavalry
C Walton
H Nichols
John Spohn
J. F. L St Thomas
J. S. Frizell
M. L. Broadwell
John Bruce
J L Griffith
James Van Deren
H, H, Harding
J B Buchanan Capt compy (D) 1st Batt Ky Cavalry

Friend Jim: Inclosed pleas finde a petition for your promotion to Col in some of our Ky regaments: I could get all or most of the union men in our County to sign it; but as a general thing, a few names are as good as a great many: hoping you may soon be promoted, as I feal that you are in every way capable to fill the office of Col I remain

Camp Speed Fry near Danville
Dec 23 1862
To His Exelency Robinson
Govenor of Kentucky
Sir this has been unsolicited on my part and I forward it for your consideration and remain
Coffman Jas. N Capt. Col. Mundy's Battalion Cav:
Recommendations for his appointment to the Colonelcy of some Ky. Cav. regt.

Military
Petition to promot Capt Jas H. Coffman to a Colonecy

Promotions must be made from the Regt. be glad to promote Mr C --
J W F
